repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Yogyakarta and Central Java
            Earthquake Roof Structure Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Yogyakarta and Central
            Java Earthquake Roof Structure Project for Indonesia were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: although the
            Java Reconstruction Fund (JRF) Roof Structure Project (RSP)
            successfully achieved its development objective; it will
            have been structured and implemented much differently if the
            actual level of need had been more accurately estimated
            prior to inception. Specifically, the estimated gap in
            coverage of housing need required a response that was beyond
            the capacity of any one agency, so both International
            Organization for Migration (IOM) and Cooperative Housing
            Foundation (CHF) International were contracted to build roof
            structures. In actuality, however, the level of need was low
            enough to easily be covered by only one group.

9748908.trustfund:
TF057623-YOGYAKARTA AND CENTRAL JAVA
            EARTHQUAKE ROOF STRUCTURE PROJECT (COOPERAT,TF058077-BANK PROJECT APPRAISAL AND
            SUPERVISION FOR JAVA RECONSTRUCTION FUND,TF090001-YOGYAKARTA AND CENTRAL JAVA
            EARTHQUAKE ROOF STRUCTURE PROJECT - INTERNA

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Yogyakarta and Central Java
            Earthquake Roof Structure Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Yogyakarta and
            Central Java Earthquake Roof Structure Project is to respond
            to the most basic needs of the households affected by the
            earthquake through the provision of roof structures that
            transition to permanent housing. The project has four
            components: (i) Preparation of Roof Structure Kits which
            involves prefabrication of the most labor intensive and
            structurally crucial elements of the building, including:
            wall components and bracing, roof frames, and connecting
            beams; (ii) Targeting and Distribution of Kits to
            Beneficiaries by which a selection of
            end-users/beneficiaries will be undertaken according to the
            following procedures: (a) Site identification, (b)
            Beneficiaries list and awareness: in consultation with the
            Kepala Desa (village head) and the community, by which a
            list of eligible households based on data on level of damage
            and number of household members will be established; and (c)
            Ex-post distribution/monitoring; (iii) Assistance to
            Beneficiaries during Construction; and (iv) Quality Control
            and Reporting.

            Central Java Earthquake Roof Structure Project is to respond
            to the most basic needs of the households affected by the
            earthquake through the provision of roof structures that
            transition to permanent housing. The Project will provide
            eligible families in targeted villages in the affected areas
            with safe and durable housing through the provision of roof
            structures while permanent house is being rebuilt. The
